alert.note: Alert for Converse County Lower Elevations; Niobrara County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 4:05PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Niobrara and eastern Converse Counties through 515 PM MDT... At 405 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Lance Creek, or 25 miles north of Lusk, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lusk, Manville, Mule Creek Junction, Lance Creek and Redbird. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM MDT for east central Wyoming.

area.areaDesc: Converse County Lower Elevations; Niobrara County
